poem:
### The Line Drawn

In the hush of morning,  
echoes of strikes dance—  
suspended breath  
between borders.

Telephones ring in  
faraway lands,  
words stretched  
like tension in the air.

Glimpses through the paper's  
thin veil—  
traces of lives  
measured in dialogues  
and decisions,  
in the fragile  
grasp of peace.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
